properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)

properly, the nearest part, i.e. the center, whether literal, figurative or adverbial (especially with preposition)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
an appellation, as amark or memorial of individuality; by implication honor, authority, character
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
properly, self (but generally used to point out more definitely the object of a verb or preposition, even or namely)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
not (the qualified negation, used as a deprecative); once (Job 24:25) as a noun, nothing
to mislay, i.e. to be oblivious of, from want of memory or attention
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
treatment, i.e. an act (of good or ill); by implication, service or requital

3.brief: properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)

4.brief: to be the next of kin (and as such to buy back a relative's property, marry his widow, etc.)
a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to encircle (for attack or protection); especially to crown (literally or figuratively)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty
compassion (in the plural); by extension, the womb (as cherishing the fetus); by implication, a maiden

5.brief: to sate, i.e. fill to satisfaction (literally or figuratively)

good (as an adjective) in the widest sense; used likewise as a noun, both in the masculine and the feminine, the singular and the plural (good, a good or good thing, a good man or woman; the good, goods or good things, good men or women), also as an adverb (well)
finery; generally an outfit; specifically, a headstall
to be new; causatively, to rebuild
the eagle (or other large bird of prey)
(only in plural collectively or emphatic form) youth, the state (juvenility) or the persons (young people)

6.brief: to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application
rightness (abstractly), subjectively (rectitude), objectively (justice), morally (virtue) or figuratively (prosperity)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

properly, a verdict (favorable or unfavorable) pronounced judicially, especially a sentence or formal decree (human or (participant's) divine law, individual or collective), including the act, the place, the suit, the crime, and the penalty; abstractly, justice, including a participant's right or privilege (statutory or customary), or even a style
properly, the whole; hence, all, any or every (in the singular only, but often in a plural sense)
to press upon, i.e. oppress, defraud, violate, overflow

7.brief: to know (properly, to ascertain by seeing); used in a great variety of senses, figuratively, literally, euphemistically and inferentially (including observation, care, recognition; and causatively, instruction, designation, punishment, etc.)
a road (as trodden); figuratively, a course of life or mode of action, often adverb
a son (as a builder of the family name), in the widest sense (of literal and figurative relationship, including grandson, subject, nation, quality or condition, etc., (like father or brother), etc.)
Jisrael, a symbolical name of Jacob; also (typically) of his posterity
an exploit (of God), or a performance (of man, often in a bad sense); by implication, an opportunity

8.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
abundant (in quantity, size, age, number, rank, quality)
kindness; by implication (towards God) piety; rarely (by opposition) reproof, or (subject.) beauty

9.brief: not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, a goal, i.e. the bright object at adistance travelled towards; hence (figuratively), splendor, or (subjectively) truthfulness, or (objectively) confidence; but usually (adverbially), continually (i.e. to the most distant point of view)
properly, to toss, i.e. grapple; mostly figuratively, to wrangle, i.e. hold a controversy; (by implication) to defend
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

to do or make, in the broadest sense and widest application

above, over, upon, or against (yet always in this last relation with a downward aspect) in a great variety of applications

15.brief: a man in general (singly or collectively)

properly, glistening, i.e. a burnished plate; also a flower (as bright-colored); a wing (as gleaming in the air)
properly, set upright; hence (figuratively as adjective) just; but usually (as adverb or conjunction) rightly or so (in various applications to manner, time and relation; often with other particles)
to twinkle, i.e. glance; by analogy, to blossom (figuratively, flourish)

16.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed

wind; by resemblance breath, i.e. a sensible (or even violent) exhalation; figuratively, life, anger, unsubstantiality; by extension, a region of the sky; by resemblance spirit, but only of a rational being (including its expression and functions)
to cross over; used very widely of any transition (literal or figurative; transitive, intransitive, intensive, causative); specifically, to cover (in copulation)
a non-entity; generally used as a negative particle
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles

properly, to scrutinize, i.e. look intently at; hence (with recognition implied), to acknowledge, be acquainted with, care for, respect, revere, or (with suspicion implied), to disregard, ignore, be strange toward, reject, resign, dissimulate (as if ignorant or disowning)
properly, iteration or continuance; used only adverbially (with or without preposition), again, repeatedly, still, more
properly, a standing, i.e. a spot; but used widely of a locality (general or specific); also (figuratively) of a condition (of body or mind)
